Package community.leaf.textchain.adventure

Class Chain<C extends Chain<C>>

java.lang.Object
community.leaf.textchain.adventure.Chain<C>
Type Parameters:
C - self-returning chain subtype (for method chaining)
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChainedAudienceSender<C>, ComponentLike
Direct Known Subclasses:
LegacyTextChain, TextChain
public abstract class Chain<C extends Chain<C>> extends Object implements ChainedAudienceSender<C>
Abstract text chain.

    • Chain

      public Chain​(WrappedTextComponentBuilder builder)

  • Method Details

    • getConstructor

      protected abstract ChainConstructor<C> getConstructor()
      Gets this chain's constructor so more chains of the same type can be created and operated on. If a subtype has more required constructor arguments than just the standard WrappedTextComponentBuilder, simply pass those dependencies along.
      Returns:
      a valid standard constructor for the chain's type

    • processText

      protected abstract TextComponent processText​(String text)
      Process the input text by converting it from a string into a text component.
      Parameters:
      text - the input text
      Returns:
      a component generated by processing the input text

    • self

      protected final C self()
      this, but generic. For generic method chaining.
      Returns:
      self as the generic chain type

    • getBuilder

      public final WrappedTextComponentBuilder getBuilder()
      Gets the internal wrapped text component builder that this chain manipulates.
      Returns:
      this chain's internal wrapped builder

    • asComponent

      public final TextComponent asComponent()
      Builds the chain.
      Specified by:
      asComponent in interface ComponentLike
      Returns:
      a text chain
      See Also:
      WrappedTextComponentBuilder.asComponent()

    • asComponentList

      public final List<Component> asComponentList()
      Builds the chain as a list of components. Since chains inherently operate on a component builder's extra (its children), most chain elements should remain intact. However, non-style aspects of this chain's root component builder will be lost.

      Note: this method is inadequate for item lore because it not only preserves new line characters ("\n"), but every child component is a distinct list entry.

      For a more lore-friendly list, use asComponentListSplitByNewLine() instead.

      Returns:
      the chain as a flattened list of components
      See Also:
      Components.flattenExtra(Component)

    • asComponentListSplitByNewLine

      public final List<Component> asComponentListSplitByNewLine()
      Builds the chain as a list of components by combining components until a new line component (containing only "\n") is encountered. Since chains inherently operate on a component builder's extra (its children), most chain elements should remain intact. However, non-style aspects of this chain's root component builder will be lost.

      Note: to obtain new line components, use the next methods like: nextLine().

      Returns:
      the chain as a flattened list of components combined until a new line is encountered
      See Also:
      Components.flattenExtraSplitByNewLine(Component)

    • apply

      public C apply​(Consumer<? super C> consumer)
      Provides the consumer with this chain. Useful for applying modifications of some sort to the chain.
      Parameters:
      consumer - a consumer
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)

    • map

      public <@NullOr V> V map​(Function<? super C,​@NullOr V> mapper)
      Maps this chain to something else.
      Type Parameters:
      V - value type
      Parameters:
      mapper - mapper function
      Returns:
      resulting value of the mapper function

    • extra

      public C extra​(Consumer<? super C> consumer)
      Provides the consumer with a chain that operates on the latest chain element's extra (its children). Use this to create a group of chain elements that will inherit the formatting and style from the latest existing chain element (or create one if none exist).
      Parameters:
      consumer - extra consumer
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)

    • thenExtra

      public C thenExtra​(Consumer<? super C> consumer)
      Provides the consumer with a chain that operates on a new chain element's extra (its children). Use this to create a group of chain elements that will inherit the formatting and style from this new chain element.
      Parameters:
      consumer - extra consumer
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)

    • then

      public C then​(ComponentLike componentLike)
      Creates a new chain element containing the provided component-like. If the component obtained from the argument is a TextComponent instance, it will be converted to a builder and added as the next chain element. Otherwise, a new, empty text component builder will be created and the component will simply be appended to it (as an extra child).
      Parameters:
      componentLike - the component-like to append
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)

    • thenEmpty

      public C thenEmpty()
      Creates a new empty chain element.
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)

    • then

      public C then​(String text, TextProcessor processor)
      Creates a new chain element by processing the input text with the provided processor.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to append
      processor - text processor
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)

    • then

      public C then​(String text)
      Creates a new chain element by first processing the input text using the chain's default processor. It's important to remember that different chain types will process the text differently. To skip processing altogether, use thenUnprocessed(String).
      Parameters:
      text - the text to append
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)

    • thenUnprocessed

      public C thenUnprocessed​(String text)
      Creates a new chain element by directly converting it to a new text component, skipping processing entirely.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to append
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)

    • nextLine

      public C nextLine()
      Inserts a new line by creating a new chain element that only contains the new line character ("\n").
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      Component.newline()

    • next

      public C next​(ComponentLike componentLike)
      Creates new chain elements by inserting a new line then appending the provided component-like.

      Note: The inserted new line is its own distinct chain element. This method is equivalent to calling: .nextLine().then(componentLike)

      Parameters:
      componentLike - the component-like to append
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      nextLine(), then(ComponentLike)

    • next

      public C next​(String text, TextProcessor processor)
      Creates new chain elements by inserting a new line then appending the text using the provided processor.

      Note: The inserted new line is its own distinct chain element. This method is equivalent to calling: .nextLine().then(text, processor)

      Parameters:
      text - the text to append
      processor - text processor
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      nextLine(), then(String, TextProcessor)

    • next

      public C next​(String text)
      Creates new chain elements by inserting a new line then appending the input text using the chain's default processor. It's important to remember that different chain types will process the text differently. To skip processing altogether, use nextUnprocessed(String).

      Note: The inserted new line is its own distinct chain element. This method is equivalent to calling: .nextLine().then(text)

      Parameters:
      text - the text to append
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      nextLine(), then(String)

    • nextUnprocessed

      public C nextUnprocessed​(String text)
      Creates new chain elements by inserting a new line then directly appending the input text, skipping processing entirely.

      Note: The inserted new line is its own distinct chain element. This method is equivalent to calling: .nextLine().thenUnprocessed(text)

      Parameters:
      text - the text to append
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      nextLine(), thenUnprocessed(String)

      public C overwriteText​(String text)

      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:

    • format

      public C format​(TextDecoration decoration)
      Formats the latest chain element with the provided decoration. The decoration state will be set to: TextDecoration.State.TRUE.
      Parameters:
      decoration - the format to apply
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      ComponentBuilder.decorate(TextDecoration)

    • format

      public C format​(TextDecoration... decorations)
      Formats the latest chain element with all provided decorations. Each decoration state will be set to: TextDecoration.State.TRUE.
      Parameters:
      decorations - the formats to apply
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      ComponentBuilder.decorate(TextDecoration...)

    • format

      public C format​(TextDecoration decoration, boolean state)
      Formats the latest chain element with the provided decoration by explicitly enabling or disabling it. If the state is true, the decoration will be enabled. Otherwise, false will disable the decoration even if a parent chain/component has the decoration enabled.
      Parameters:
      decoration - the format type
      state - the state to set
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      ComponentBuilder.decoration(TextDecoration, boolean)

    • format

      public C format​(TextDecoration decoration, TextDecoration.State state)

      Parameters:
      decoration - the format type
      state - the state to set
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      ComponentBuilder.decoration(TextDecoration, TextDecoration.State)

    • tooltip

      public C tooltip​(ComponentLike componentLike)
      Sets the hover event of the latest chain element to a text tooltip containing the provided component-like.
      Parameters:
      componentLike - the tooltip component
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      hover(HoverEventSource)

    • tooltip

      public C tooltip​(Consumer<? super C> tooltipConsumer)
      Sets the hover event of the latest chain element to a text tooltip as a result of supplying the provided consumer with a new, empty chain for it to manipulate. Once the consumer is finished modifying the fresh chain, it is then converted into a component and set as the tooltip. The received chain is the same generic type as the original chain since it uses the same constructor.
      Parameters:
      tooltipConsumer - consumer that modifies an empty chain that will then become the tooltip
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      hover(HoverEventSource)

    • tooltip

      public C tooltip​(String tooltipText, TextProcessor processor)
      Sets the hover event of the latest chain element to a tooltip containing the input text processed by the provided processor.
      Parameters:
      tooltipText - text to display when hovered over
      processor - text processor
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      hover(HoverEventSource), then(String, TextProcessor)

    • tooltip

      public C tooltip​(String tooltipText)
      Sets the hover event of the latest chain element to a tooltip containing the input text processed by the chain's default processor. It's important to remember that different chain types will process the text differently. To skip processing altogether, use tooltipUnprocessed(String).
      Parameters:
      tooltipText - text to display when hovered over
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      hover(HoverEventSource), then(String)

    • tooltipUnprocessed

      public C tooltipUnprocessed​(String tooltipText)
      Sets the hover event of the latest chain element to a tooltip containing the input text, skipping processing entirely.
      Parameters:
      tooltipText - text to display when hovered over
      Returns:
      self (for method chaining)
      See Also:
      hover(HoverEventSource), thenUnprocessed(String)
